Influencer Marketing: How To Find The Right One

In our previous blog, we outlined what influencer marketing is all about. An Influencer is a person who will promote our product as a third party, making our message more believable.

On paper, this sounds too good to be true. But for many small store owners, the budget that we have to set aside for influencers could have been better invested elsewhere, which begs the question – How can we get the Best out of Influencer Marketing?

In order to succeed, the benefits of our influencer marketing campaign have to offset our costs. To do that, we need a concrete strategy, and every good strategy begins with research. The first question we must ask ourselves is – “What do I want to achieve?”

Depending on whether our goal is to spread our word or increase sales, our campaign, deliverables and even influencer choice will vary. So, the first step is to set some SMART goals to guide the process of influencer selection and evaluation of influencer performance.



Selecting the right influencer

Winter is the season of holidays! It’s starts with Halloween, Thanksgiving, and ends with Christmas and New Year. The holidays are one of the major reasons you see a spur in consumer demand. You have to embrace the holiday themes in your store. Redesign your website with appropriate props and colors. For example- you can use a red and white theme for Christmas and design it with image props like- the Santa hat, snowfall, reindeer etc. Also, focus on creating separate sections with festival collections and offers as well. Doing all this adds a festive mood to the store, making celebrations more and more special for both your customers and yourself!


Bring back the nostalgia

Winter is the season of nostalgia. It’s the season that brings back old memories and creates now ones at the same time. It’s the season of singing carols, spending hours playing with snowballs and building Snowmen. It’s the season when the entire family seats around the fireplace, opens presents under the Christmas tree on the Christmas morning and sings Christmas carols together. These are the emotions you have to channel to your customers. In your winter collections, try to add lifestyle photos that portray such nostalgic moments with your products in us. It is also a good idea to use common catchphrases like “Ho ho ho” or famous quotes like- “Winter is Coming” from the show Game of Thrones to bring a smile on your consumers face.

Focus on Customer Interaction

The best marketing is one that connects and communicates with customers. Winter is the season when people stay at home more to protect themselves against the cold weather. This enables them to have more free time. Utilize this by holding surveys and quizzes where you try to learn what your customers are looking for and how they perceive your brand. Your clients are surely the best judges of your business. These tactics will help you gain insights about consumer preferences and habits and get feedback as well. Keeping the holidays in mind, you can hold different contests as well. For instance- announcing a photography contest (with a desired reward, obviously) where people post their “best winter memory”. This way, you’ll be able to bring out nostalgic memories and have your page filled with heartwarming photographs as well. These tactics will help increase the visibility of your store and likely increase your traffic as well.

Arrange for Sales and Offers

As the weather changes abruptly, people require a change in most of the items they own – be it the dresses they wear or the home decor to keep the house warm. But income doesn’t increase proportionately with spending needs, does it? Be the understanding, consumer-friendly seller you are and focus on setting reasonable prices that benefit both you and the consumer. Here, focusing on making a profit from bulk quantities rather than from setting high prices is a more appropriate strategy. Also, offer discounts and hold sales on your website and market them on all your advertising channels as this is the time people are likely looking for sales to fit all their demanded products within their budget.


Focus more on Social Media Marketing

As we discussed earlier, during winter, people get more time to be on their phones as the cold forces them to stay at home. As a result, an increase in online shopping has been observed as well. This is the reason you should focus more on social media marketing. Start by making a calendar and properly planning your posts. It’s important to maintain consistency and relevancy in the content you post. This is why your content should be in line with the product and industry you operate in. Use social media to highlight the products on your website. Also, update viewers of the offers, deals, and discounts you’re offering on your website. Run polls asking them what kinds of collections they want to see next and take their opinions on different matters. Make sure you post high quality product images of the products you’re selling right now or hope to sell in the future. High quality images will help your customers know how attractive your product really is, whereas poor quality images will drag down the reputation of your business.

Make shopping an experience, not a chore

Winter is the time to shower your close ones with gifts and surprises. Make your customers feel like a part of your family by providing them with small gifts that catches them by surprise. The gifts don’t have to be expensive as well; rather it’s the surprise element that will get you on their good books. Also, arrange giveaways by inviting them to help expand this family of yours. As they refer your website to their dear ones or invite them to your social Medias, it will help your help you enter new horizons.


Let’s make winter easier!

While winter showers a lot of people with feelings of joy, many suffer from misery due to their poor financial conditions. By engaging in Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR), you can use your business to make winter easier. For example, you can launch campaigns where a specific percentage of every sale goes to help people in need. Setting reasonable prices can help people greatly too, as it enables them to buy more products. Doing these things will likely generate a positive image for your business and may even end up boosting your sales. But be careful as you arrange such campaigns. Whatever you do should be from the heart, and the intent to do something good has to be present as well.

Winter is the season of joy- for both consumers and sellers. It’s full of festivals, excitement and happiness. It’s the time for your e-commerce store to shine and rise up conversion rate. All this is achievable by simply following the right marketing strategies and giving your full focus and effort.
